edu.gatech.mbse.transformations.sysml2milp

Class SysML2MILPTransformation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gatech.mbse.transformations.sysml2milp.SysML2MILPTransformation

  • public class SysML2MILPTransformation
extends java.lang.Object
    SysML to MILP transformation.

    Currently, a "shortcut" is taken, i.e., SysML Model -> Solver Specific Syntax. Ideally, this should occur in multiple stages, which should be done in future versions of this transformation:
    1) SysML -> Instance: number of instances determined by functional spec
    2) Instance -> MILP Model
    3) MILP Model -> Tool-Specific Textual Syntax
    Required for this are a proper DSML, or generation of instances on SysML / UML side, MILP meta-model. While sketches of all of this exists, implementation would take quite a while. The transformation as currently is in this file should be seen as an intermediate step towards this goal.

    Version:
    0.1.2
    Author:
    Sebastian

      • setupTransformationUtils

        private void setupTransformationUtils()
        Set up all utility classes that are used in the transformation. Currently this is the MILP code generation object.

      • transform

        public java.lang.String transform(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Activity functionalSpec,
                         org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element rootElement,
                         int numSolutions,
                         boolean testingMode)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Execute the transformation.

        This function transforms a given SysML activity to a MILP problem. It returns MILP code that conforms to the syntax of the configured target environment.

        Parameters:
        topLevelActivity - The functional specification (UML Activity).
        rootElement - The root model element.
        numSolutions - The number of solutions that the MILP solver should generate.
        testingMode - If on, no excel output or instance data will be generated by the MILP solving environment. Instead, a temporary file writing all displayed results to a file is created. This is typically only set to true in the continuous integration system or when running JUnit tests.
        Returns:
        The generated MILP code.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the transformation failed to find a system under design or an objective.

      • transformSystemUnderDesign

        private java.lang.String transformSystemUnderDesign()
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Transform the system under design defined in the SysML model.
        Returns:
        MILP code representing and defining the system under design.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If system under design or objective could not be located in model.

      • transformResourceLibrary

        private java.lang.String transformResourceLibrary()
        Transform the resources in the resource library. This step involves:
        1) Determining the number of necessary instances for a given resource type
        2) Creating instances in the background (not explicitly) and mapping these into MILP code
        Returns:
        MILP code representing possible resource instances or the empty string if no resources are relevant to the problem.

      • transformFunctionalSpecification

        private java.lang.String transformFunctionalSpecification()
        Transforms the functional specification.

        This function simply calls SysML2MILPMappings.mapFunctionalSpecification(Activity, MILPModel2TextUtils).

        Returns:
        MILP representation of the functional specification.

      • transformFunctionStructureDependentConstraints

        private java.lang.String transformFunctionStructureDependentConstraints()
        Transforms shareability constraints.

        Simply calls SysML2MILPMappingsHelper.addResourceShareabilityConstraints(MILPModel2TextUtils).

        Returns:
        MILP code that contains a set of constraints.

      • preComputeInternalCorrespondences

        private void preComputeInternalCorrespondences()
        Pre-compute all internal correspondences. These internal correspondences are used to determine which string representations various objects will have in the output MILP.

      • getResourcesInProcessingOrder

        private org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element[] getResourcesInProcessingOrder()
        Re-orders list of resources into an array such that composites come last. This is done because parts of composites must be defined before the composites themselves.
        Returns:
        An array of UML Elements representing resources in the order that they should be processed within the transformation.

      • determineMaxPossibleInstances

        private int determineMaxPossibleInstances(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Classifier resource)
        Determines the maximum number of instances for a given resource within the context of a particular functional specification.
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource type.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of instances possibly required in any solution.
